comment: She is a nice person but not a great teacher. You get many assignments and she is not helpful if you ask her questions. Only take her class if you got an A in high school lit and enjoy lots of reading.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Tough grader

comment: I did learn a few things in Professor Mary Kay's class, and she cares about her students but this class is not worth the insane amount of effort you have to put in to get a good grade. There are assignments every single day and her choice of films and materials to read in class are disturbing and focus on weird topics.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: MaryKay has a really tough grading criteria and there is lots of work to be done. Take this course only if your other courses are light because this course literally takes up all your time. You need to read or write every day there is class and if you submit your papers even a second late you fail the course. You also need to participate everyday.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I really liked Mary Kay, but the atmosphere of the class was very clique like. She didnt explain her assignments thoroughly for those of us who didnt have her for 1101, but she is really kind and funny.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: All content and essays are about monsters, death, sex or overall disgusting/weird stuff. You have to read/watch really horrific/nasty stuff. If its not your thing STEER CLEAR! She wont accept ANYTHING late. Not even a minute. NO EXCUSES. Must be completed too. She doesn't accept essays below the page requirement. Wish I never took her class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Take a Saturday class before this professor. Not. Kidding. She is a professor who takes what is supposed to be a creative, self expressive subject and makes it unnecessarily challenging. Dont even think about late work or extra credit. I am someone who English was my easy A and I am currently struggling for a C.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Basically, what everyone is saying, she acts really nice at first but she is actually really harsh when it comes to grades. You have homework every single day and it's not easy either. The essays have very specific guidelines that can cost you big time. I would not recommend taking her because there are better teachers here.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Mary Kay is hilarious and makes classes fun. You have five absences but she is very understanding about needing to miss class. She wants everyone to participate, but it isn't hard if you read the things you're supposed to. I took her for 1101 and loved her class so much I'm currently taking her for 1102. Your writing will greatly improve in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Mary is one of the best teacher's I've ever had. She's thorough, cares, and is equally fair to all students in her classes. Some students complain because she doesn't accept late work but lets be serious, there is plenty of time to complete it. I recommend anyone wanting to actually learn in a fun environment to choose her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Caring

comment: She is not a bad teacher, but you must actively participate in class and you can not be tardy! She has very specific peeves with grading essays and will penalize you very harshly if you make one of these mistakes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mary Kay is super funny. She is clear what she wants, but still when you think you do well, you can bomb an assignment. Homework really counts. Showing up is mandatory or she docks your grade. Her class can be a bit repetitive with topics, but her humor makes up for it. Super hard, but you learn to be a better writer with her feedback.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: Everyone who is looking at all of the negative reviews and taking them seriously please listen to this. This is my first English class outside of highschool and I found her to be very caring and helpful. If you are willing to try she has the ability to mold you into a fantastic writer. It is not as much work as everyone whining about her says it is
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Mary Kay is my favorite professor I've had this semester. Her class is enjoyable and interesting, as long as you come prepared. Do your reading responses and prepare for discussions. She is caring and answers any questions about assignments. She gives really constructive feedback on essays - my writing has improved so much because of her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Mary Kay is a good professor if you are serious about college. If you come to class willing to work, she will love you. Do not be one of those students who thinks they can just not show up to class and pass. She is a bit of a tough grader but she gives a very detailed rubric stating exactly what she wants in a paper. I really recommend her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She acts very energetic and great at first, but she is a terrible teacher. She grades irrationally and if you have real excused absences she doesn't even care which sucks because 5+ absences automatically drop your grade 10 points.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Inspirational

comment: She's such a great professor. She's really funny and relatable, which makes her easy to talk to. Classes are pretty much discussion based, you have homework each class but it isn't that bad. Only a few essays, the rest is just homework grades. You get 5 absences. She explains things really well and will answer any question.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: She is not understanding when it comes to late work, no matter what the circumstance is. She is a very tough grader and does not give good feedback. There is so much work to do in this class, homework every single night, almost like she doesn't think students have other classes to study for. Very moody.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mary Kay is a super sweet and energetic professor. She makes you really engage when she's talking in class but besides that she's not the best. Even though she has kind eyes she snaps out of nowhere and becomes a different person who doesn't care about anything you have to say. She has given out many zeros on essays because they were 5 minutes late
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: When you first meet her, you think she is nice and that she is a good professor but she is the complete opposite. Her grading is very unclear and she does not specifically let you know what to fix. She does not care about any problems or concerns you are having. She is easily the WORST professor I have ever had. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASSES
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Mary Kay is a wonderful teacher. She reminds me of kelly from the office (in a good way). She definitely knows her subject and plans fun and interesting lessons and assignments. If you show up too class and participate in the class discussions you'll do fine. Show her you really care and she'll reciprocate the sentiments.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: Her class is enjoyable, but if you don't do the required work you will not pass. Put in the effort, and you should do fine.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Ms. McBrayer is an Excellent Professor. She is very easy to talk to if you have questions and she is very accessible. DO NOT expect her class to be easy. Put in the work and you will get the grade you deserve. She does assign a lot of homework but it's not just busy work. Show respect and you will be respected.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Mary Kay is awesome! She's sweet, energetic, funny, and genuinely wants to help her students when there is confusion. She starts each class with an attendance question which is always fun. Attendance is a must if you want to pass. There are 4 essays and if you follow her guidelines, you will do great. Just do your work and do not expect an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Mary Kay puts on a face that makes you think that she is a good teacher but she really is not. Her grading system is ridiculous with over the top requirements. The homework is nothing more than busy work that takes upwards of two hours and if you try to talk to her about any concern you have she simply does not care about what you have to say.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mary Kay is a great person, has a great sense of humor and keeps the class interesting. There is a heavy workload, and it will not be an easy grade, but she makes sure you understand exactly what you need to do in order to make that A. I have really enjoyed her class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: First of all she is a babe, and her class is really enjoyable. Second? You had better prepare yourself, she is not going to give you an easy grade for just showing up. There are daily questions and a good amount of reading/homework assignments. If you're willing to put in the effort you're going to come away from the class better than you entered.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She seems really great and interesting at first but then it gets boring. Her daily attendance question thing is good though. She seems like she cares but don't let that fool you. You screw up one paper and you are screwed, no chance of redoing or getting points back. All absences count the same and no notes are accepted which is ridiculous.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mary Kay is a great professor. She is funny and her class is very engaging. But she does not care about your grade. She doesn't take late work no matter the excuse. She hates phones, and she can lose her temper very quickly. Be prepared to work for hours on busy work. Miss more than 2 classes, you will fail.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mary Kay is a great professor, an awesome person, quick to help students, & very energetic. Every class starts with a fun question. Only a few quizzes/essays, but homework every class. The expectations are very clear from the beginning so it's easy to succeed, therefor she doesn't accept hardly any excuses. I wish more professors were like her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Great teacher, Always incredibly energetic. Tough Grade for sure, but she is incredibly fair with it too. There is a lot of class interaction, and she does not read from slides. There weren't really any notes, but it was more just class discussion to help peers gain a better understanding of their text to allow them more comprehension.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: I love this professor, she is very very nice, i would definitley take her class again. she makes everything really fun and what seems like pointless work it's not it really really helps later on in the course. she's funny and smart and very accessible out of class. Definitley recommended
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Would take again

comment: A really cool person in general, I took her as a hybrid so I only saw her once a week. She was really into her students and seems to care a lot, also has office hours. Lots of discussions and not too bad of a work load. Incorporates movies into her assignments so the work is bearable but she did struggle with D2L but she's just figuring it out
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: She's such a sweet lady but her class is a bit ridiculous. "ice breakers" everyday. She's very high energy but you have at least 2 hours of homework each night and she's a heavy grader with test. She's good with feedback but she's not very lenient and doesnt have much intention of helping your grade
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: She's a great teacher. Her classes are always interesting and she is a fun person. Beware of having homework every single class. There's three papers and three quizzes. She does all she can to prepare you for them. If you put in the effort it is a good professor to pick for your English class. Attendancemandatory but she has like two off weeks
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Great professor. She is very high energy and has a great attendance policy. She is understanding and has a genuine interest in your ideas as a student. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I would never take this class, again. E V E R ! Grading rubric is harsh. She'll  belittle you as if your the one asking stupid questions. She's sweet when she wants to be, but if it comes down to your way or hers, believe me, you will be ruled out! She has a my way or highway attitude, run. Someone needs to put her back in her place. Good riddance!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: hardest english class ive ever taken dont listen to the other reviews. shes cool and all but her brutal grading hardly EVER makes it worth it. if anything i hate english more now
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Mary Kay is a tough grader on papers, but she gives feedback and there are chances for revision. She requires everyone to participate and speak up in class. Overall, she is a great professor who makes class interesting and focuses on materials and readings that are interesting to students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor, she based her whole class off of monsters in the selections we read. If you participate and follow her instructions you will have no problem getting an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She takes attendance, miss too many classes and you fail, period. There's 1 group project. Her grading criteria is semi clear for assignments. She tells you not to use "is" on essays. My father who majored in journalism thought that was an absurd writing requirement, but it's her standard. Overall medium workload and she always answers questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: M. K. McBrayer is hands down the hardest English teacher I've ever had. I'm not a  writing pro but she destroyed everything I gave her, despite it being similar as those who got A's and B's; seemed to be an unfair grader. But shes a great professor; funny, witty and gives content she knows students will enjoy reading & writing about.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: She's a nice person and a really intensive grader. Homework is given after almost every class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is the best professor I have had at Kennesaw State. She is hilarious, so sweet, and genuinely cares about all her students. I wish all professors were like her. The semester is well planned and I have yet to stress out in this class. Highly, highly, highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Mary Kay is SO fun & hilarious. She keeps class entertaining & loves participation. Gives a good bit of reading but the pieces are usually short & interesting. Two 3-4 page essays on poetry/prose & a research paper on a movie - she'll give you a list of options. She's a fair grader and allows up to a full letter grade revision on essays! Love her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The grades aren't on D2L , which bothered me.  Too much homework and way too tough of a grader for an 1102 class.
She  is ok. Very difficult grader when it comes to essays. Don't expect an easy A.

I had her for english 1102 and I really enjoyed the class. She gave a lot of readings and wanted us to write open ended questions for them , but it wasn't bad at all just don't forget to do them! You get a few easy vocab quizzes and you have  4 papers and 1 is the research paper. She is always there to help and makes it an enjoyable class to be in!
